# nvim: refactor plugins into modules, remove bundled phase

Refactors nvim plugin management to use the module system instead of custom scripts, and simplifies the build by removing the bundled phase.

## Changes

- 3p/nvim-conform, nvim-mini, nvim-lspconfig, nvim-treesitter - new modules with version.lua
- 3p/nvim-parsers - compiles treesitter .so parsers using nvim + nvim-treesitter
- 3p/nvim/cook.mk - overrides `nvim_dir` to bundle nvim + plugins + parsers
- Makefile - removes bundled phase, `_dir` defaults to `_staged`, modules can override

## Removed

- .config/nvim/nvim-pack-lock.json - replaced by individual version.lua files
- 3p/nvim/bundle.lua, fetch-plugin.lua, test.lua - bundling now in cook.mk

## Build pipeline

Before: versioned → fetched → staged → bundled → done
After: versioned → fetched → staged → done (nvim adds post-stage via `_dir` override)

## Validation

- [x] `make test` passes
- [x] incremental builds work
- [x] nvim plugins load correctly
- [x] treesitter parsers compile and load
